Job Title: Principal, Review Specialist

Location: Akron, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job SummaryThe Principal is primarily responsible for approving and accepting submitted paperwork as well as reviewing and approving Pershing brokerage and direct business transactions. Principal will accept business risk on behalf of Valmark within compliance guidelines and regulatory requirements including resolving Not in Good Order (NIGO) business related to RegBI, DOL, and suitability. 

Essential Functions and Responsibilities and approve new business and transaction related requests, including but not limited to T+1/post-transaction review through the use of electronic imaging and our workflow systems.and resolve post transaction cases in NIGO queues, confirm or override NIGOs, approve business as appropriate.assistance to Sr. Principals in performing day-to-day responsibilities as directed.with any special approvals or projects related to risk management.in reviewing and updating the following tools: PASS Form, Rollover Tool, Benchmarking Data, 529/Breakpoint Resources, etc.in reviewing and updating principal review guidelines.in reviewing eDeposit check ledger monthly to monitor, review, and identify rollover transactions defined by the DOL and ensure compliance.research support regarding the Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT) and assist with resolving any deficiencies.in reviewing MSRB trade reconciliation reports and ensure transactions are compliant with the MSRB regulations and rules.compliance with Written Supervisory Procedures (WSP) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) program.management when potential business risks on business submitted have been identified and business is not in accordance with compliance guidelines and regulatory requirements.knowledge of current regulatory requirements (i.e. RegBI, DOL, MSRB, etc.).detailed notes in CRM for further processing by other team members and for use for regulatory requirements and audits.backup assistance to other team members as business needs dictate, (i.e. Investment Operations call queue).other tasks assigned by management.

Core Competencies knowledge of financial industry, regulations, and investment productsknowledge of Valmark Operations procedures, paperwork, and processingknowledge of various technologies: Microsoft Office and CRM, OnBase, MyCase, LaserApp, vendor software (Schwab and Pershing), Albridge, DST Visionwritten and verbal communication skills, with the ability to deal effectively with various people including staff, management, vendors, and Member Officesto work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously to meet standard level service agreementsto be a self-motivated, independent worker, while occasionally working effectively in a team environmentanalytical, problem-solving, research skills 
Supervisory Responsibility The Principal, Review Specialist will not have any supervisory responsibilities. 

Required Education and Experience Degree in Finance or related field or 3+ years of financial services industry experienceregistration: Series 24 or requirement to obtain certification within 6 months of start dateand Health Insurance License

Preferred Education and Experience years of financial services industry experienceregistration: Series 53 or equivalentdesignation (CFP, CPA, MBA)in operational process improvement (Lean 6 Sigma, Kaizen)

Physical DemandsThis is a largely sedentary role; however, some walking is required. Individuals may need to sit or stand as needed. This position may require walking primarily on a level surface for short periods of time.

Expected Hours of WorkDays and typical hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Flexibility in working hours may be allowed, but the employee must work 40 hours each week to maintain full-time status. 
 Valmark reserves the right to modify, interpret, or apply this job description in any way the Company desires. This job description in no way implies this is an all-inclusive list of responsibilities to be performed by the Employee in this position.This job description is not an employment contract, implied or otherwise. The employment relationship remains “at-will”.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
